document_name: Letter of Agreement with Al Quds University
CSA with Norway- Right to Education
Cost Sharing Agreement- Establishment of Public Library in E.Jerusalem

outputs.output_descr: In this project 3.5 Km of southern side 10.5 meter width of Al Hurria road will be paved to connect Al Rashid Road with Salah El Deen Road where approximately 40,000 square meter will be paved, 10,500 meter of curbstone will be constructed, 550 meter of storm water pipes will be installed, 80 meter of sewage networks will be installed and 10 lightening poles at cross roads will be installed.  In addition, 15 used solid waste equipment will be delivered.

The intervention aims towards the establishment and operation of a public library in Jerusalem through the rehabilitating, furnishing and equipping of a historical building in the Old City of Jerusalem, located in Aqbat Risas.

The building includes 3 floors and was originally intended to be used for library, and it currently is used to accommodate the Archeology Department of Al Quds University. 

The establishment of the library will be implemented through the following activities:
-	Rehabilitation and renovation for the existing building and its structure
-	Provision of books and literature
-	Provision of IT equipment, safety and security items and systems
-	Provision of a library system
-	Establishment of Cafeteria and provision of related equipments
-	Furnishing the halls with specialized equipment
-	Establishing a website for the library
-	Training and capacity building of the Al Quds University in Library management

The project aims to reinforce education system managed by the Jerusalem Directorate of Education in East Jerusalem; it will focus on provision of additional classrooms by procuring residential buildings and transforming them into school facilities, in addition to, providing technical assistance for improving quality education by enhancing the capacity of the supervision department and counselors and carrying out comprehensive mapping for Awqaf/ JDoE education system to improve the sector efficiency and effectiveness

This project will comprise the rehabilitation and upgrading of an existing ward at the hospital into a full-fledged neurology department with all the required medical equipment and furnishings, the provision of medical gas systems, energy efficient fixtures and safety measures.

The Project's overall objective is to support the efforts of the Palestinian Ministry of Health to improve the access to healthcare services in East Jerusalem and, more specifically, to contribute towards sustainability through the deployment of renewable energy and implementation of energy efficient interventions at the St. Joseph's Hospital in East Jerusalem. The Project comprises the following main activities:

(a)	Installation of PV System at the roof top of St. Joseph's Hospital; 
(b)	Installation of Energy Management Systems; and
(c)	Replacement or Upgrading of the existing lighting system.

The new phase of the project will target 40 low income families and will comprise a survey and assessment of housing units in East Jerusalem that are in need of renovation and subject to demolition orders, and the renovation and rehabilitation of said units. The works will be specific to the needs of the housing units in question. Indicative interventions are likely to include, inter alia, structural works, renovation to roofs, walls and flooring, maintenance of the connections to the sewer network, electricity and plumbing related works, water supply and sanitation facilities, plastering and painting as well as insulation including the provision of doors and windows.

project_descr: The FAIR programme is a multi-donor platform which aims to empower and strengthen national institutions to plan and deliver essential public and social Infrastructure in 'Area C' and East Jerusalem
